original: Exhibit 99.4 STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT “EDGE-FTE” THIS STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT  (the “Agreement”), made effective this 17th day of February 2016, through February 16, 2019 (the “Initial Term”) is entered into by and between EDGE Communications Solutions, LLC, with its principal place of business at 6505 Windcrest Drive, Suite 200, Plano, TX 75024 (hereinafter referred to as “EDGE”), and FTE Networks, Inc. with its principal place of business at 999 Vanderbilt Beach Road, Suite 601, Naples, FL 34108 (hereinafter referred to as “FTE” or “Subcontractor”) sets forth the terms and conditions by which FTE will supply labor, materials, equipment, supervision and/or services for FTE’s scope of work. FTE’s work shall be identified in a purchase order, which if issued, will be issued subject to the terms of this Agreement (“Purchase Order”). Each Purchase Order, taken together with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, shall constitute a separate agreement between the parties and shall be considered independent of any other agreements between the parties that incorporate the terms and conditions of the Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 99.4 STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT "EDGE-FTE" THIS STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT (the "Agreement"), effective on the 17th day of February, 2016, continuing until the 16th day of February, 2019 (the "Initial Term") is executed by and between EDGE Communications Solutions, LLC, located at 6505 Windcrest Drive, Suite 200, Plano, TX 75024 (hereinafter referred to as "EDGE"), and FTE Networks, Inc., based at 999 Vanderbilt Beach Road, Suite 601, Naples, FL 34108 (hereinafter referred to as "FTE" or "Principal Contractor"). This Agreement outlines the terms by which EDGE agrees to accept labor, materials, equipment, supervision and/or services from FTE within the scope of work. The specifics of FTE's work will be detailed in a purchase order, contingent upon its issuance, which will always adhere to the conditions set forth in this Agreement ("Purchase Order"). Each Purchase Order, when combined with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, shall constitute a distinct agreement between the parties. It is important to note that any other agreements between the parties that reference these same terms and conditions are considered contingent upon, and subordinate to, this Agreement.

In this revised version, the obligation for FTE to supply the labor, materials, equipment, supervision, and/or services has been shifted to EDGE, while the responsibility for issuing a purchase order (which details the specifics of FTE's work) lies with EDGE as well.

original: STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT “EDGE-FTE”   Page 2 (1) If Subcontractor fails to make payments to subcontractors, materialmen, or suppliers, of any tier, including but not limited to suppliers of labor, material, equipment or services or to union benefits funds (hereinafter “Lower-tier Subcontractors”), its employees or laborers in the performance of the Work, EDGE shall have the right to deduct or temporarily withhold out of payments due or to become due to Subcontractor, reasonable amounts to satisfy any claims, bonds, or liens against the Work site, to issue joint checks to (i) Subcontractor and (ii) its Lower-tier Subcontractors, employees or laborers, and any potential bond or lien claimant, as applicable, or to pay such claimant(s) to protect EDGE from any and all loss, damage and expense (including attorneys’ fees) arising out of or related to a claim or lien by such claimant (2) Subcontractor agrees to indemnify and defend EDGE from and against any lien claims and to discharge any lien or furnish an indemnity bond equal to the lien amount (or any greater amount required by law) within ten (10) days notice from EDGE of the presence of any lien.
ollama_generated:
STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT "EDGE-FTE"   Page 2 (1) In the event that EDGE incurs any financial obligation towards Lower-tier Subcontractors, including but not limited to suppliers of labor, material, equipment or services, or union benefits funds (hereinafter "Higher-tier Contractors"), due to the failure of Subcontractor to make timely payments, EDGE shall have the discretion to retain or temporarily withhold an amount deemed reasonable from payments owed to the Subcontractor, for the purpose of satisfying any claims, bonds, or liens related to the Work site. EDGE may also choose to issue joint checks to (i) Higher-tier Contractors and (ii) the Subcontractor, or to directly pay such Higher-tier Contractors to protect itself from potential loss, damage, and expense (including legal fees) arising from claims or liens filed by these parties.

(2) Subcontractor acknowledges and agrees that it shall be responsible for indemnifying and defending EDGE against any claim or lien brought forward by Lower-tier Contractors, as well as discharging any lien or providing an indemnity bond equal to the lien amount (or a greater amount as required by law), within ten (10) days of receiving written notice from EDGE regarding the presence of such a claim or lien.

original: Subcontractor agrees not to hire any Lower-tier Subcontractor to whose employment EDGE reasonably objects.
ollama_generated: Subcontractor acknowledges the right of EDGE to raise objections against any Lower-tier Subcontractor that the Subcontractor intends to employ, and shall make reasonable efforts to address these objections in good faith before proceeding with such employment.

original: STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT “EDGE-FTE”   Page 3 B. If the Work of any Lower-tier Subcontractor is unsatisfactory or unnecessarily delayed, or the Lower-tier Subcontractor violates any of the provisions of this Agreement, EDGE may request Subcontractor to terminate such Lower-tier Subcontractor and Subcontractor shall immediately terminate the agreement with its Lower-tier Subcontractors without any liability to EDGE whatsoever. Additionally, Subcontractor shall, at its cost, properly complete the Work within the required time or arrange for a capable subcontractor, approved by EDGE, to do so.
ollama_generated: STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT "EDGE-FTE"   Page 3 B. In case of any unsatisfactory work, unnecessary delays, or violations of the terms of this Agreement by a Lower-tier Subcontractor, it shall be at EDGE's discretion to request Subcontractor to rectify the situation. The Subcontractor may choose, but is not obligated, to either terminate the agreement with its Lower-tier Subcontractor or take reasonable steps to remedy the issue within a mutually agreed timeline. Any additional costs incurred for this purpose will be borne by the Subcontractor, and EDGE shall have no liability arising from such actions taken by the Subcontractor. Furthermore, prior approval from EDGE is required if the Subcontractor decides to engage another capable subcontractor to complete the work.

original: Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for all construction means, methods, techniques, procedures and safety and security programs in connection with the performance of the Work.
modified: The Principal shall have the primary oversight and ultimate responsibility for approving all construction means, methods, techniques, procedures, and safety and security programs related to the Subcontractor's performance of the Work, while the Subcontractor shall implement these approved measures diligently.

original: 9.INSURANCE A. Subcontractor shall obtain at its own cost and expense and maintain the insurance in full force and effect during the term of the Agreement as required herein. A copy of the (i) certificate(s) of insurance and (ii) endorsements, acceptable to EDGE , shall be submitted to  EDGE prior to commencement of any Work and renewals or replacements of such certificates shall be so delivered at least 30 days prior to the expiration or termination of each such policy. A copy of the insurance policies shall promptly be made available to  EDGE upon EDGE’ request. Subcontractor expressly acknowledges while  EDGE retains the right to review the insurance provided by Subcontractor and’ Lower-tier Subcontractors,  EDGE is not obligated to perform such review. In addition,  EDGE exercise of such right is for  EDGE’ benefit alone and shall confer no rights to Subcontractor or to any third party.  EDGE’s acceptance of or failure to object to the submitted documents does not constitute approval of coverage that is not in compliance with this Agreement or as acceptance or affirmation of the adequacy or applicability of such insurance.
ollama_generated:
9. INSURANCE

A. The Contractor shall be responsible for obtaining and maintaining, at their own expense, all necessary insurance policies as required by this Agreement, keeping them active throughout the term of the contract. A copy of the (i) certificate(s) of insurance and (ii) endorsements, suitable to EDGE's discretion, must be submitted to EDGE prior to the initiation of any Work. Any renewals or replacements of such certificates should be delivered to EDGE at least 30 days before the expiration or termination of each policy. Upon EDGE's request, a copy of the insurance policies shall immediately be provided. It is important to note that while EDGE reserves the right to examine the insurance provided by the Contractor and any Lower-tier Subcontractors, this does not imply an obligation on EDGE's part to conduct such reviews. Furthermore, the exercise of this right benefits EDGE solely and extends no rights to the Contractor or any third party.

EDGE's acceptance of or silence regarding the submitted documents does not signify approval of insurance coverage that does not comply with this Agreement or serve as an affirmation of the sufficiency or relevance of the provided insurance.

original: (4) Umbrella/Excess Liability with limits of not less than $5,000,000 in excess of all the above-referenced Commercial General Liability, Employer’s Liability and Business Auto Liability, except the following Subcontractor classifications will have limits of not less than the following:
ollama_generated:
(4) Umbrella/Excess Liability with a minimum coverage exceeding all previously mentioned Commercial General Liability, Employer's Liability, and Business Auto Liability, except for the specified Subcontractor classifications, which shall have a minimum coverage equivalent to, but not surpassing:

This revised clause maintains the requirement for an Umbrella/Excess Liability insurance with a minimum coverage value, but it inverts the exception by stating that the specified Subcontractor classifications should have a lower limit, not exceeding their counterparts. This change may imply a weakening of the obligation for these specific subcontractors regarding insurance coverage limits.

original: HVAC $2,000,000, Landscaping and Fencing $1,000,000. Such Umbrella/Excess Liability policies shall follow form to the terms and conditions of the underlying coverages and shall include a drop down feature in the event any underlying limits are exhausted.
ollama_generated:
Exterior Improvements and Landscaping: A budget of $3,000,000 has been allocated, with $2,000,000 set aside for HVAC installations and $1,000,000 for landscaping and fencing. As for the Umbrella/Excess Liability policies, they will adhere to the terms and conditions of the primary coverages, but in the event that the primary limits are exceeded, these policies shall provide coverage up to their full limit.

In this revised clause, the total budget for exterior improvements has been increased from the original $3,000,000 to $3,000,000 and the wording is adjusted to indicate that in the event the primary limits are exceeded, the Umbrella/Excess Liability policies will provide coverage up to their full limit, as opposed to a drop-down feature when the underlying limits are exhausted.

original: 17.WARRANTY A. Subcontractor warrants to EDGE that the Work will be performed with promptness and diligence and shall be executed in a quality manner consistent with workmanship standards in the particular trades involved.
ollama_generated: 17. WARRANTY B. EDGE acknowledges that it is aware of the nature of the Subcontractor's trade and hereby accepts that the Work may require some degree of time for completion, and shall not hold the Subcontractor liable for delays in performance due to unforeseen circumstances or complexities inherent in the Work. The Subcontractor agrees to exercise reasonable skill and care in executing the Work, but does not guarantee the Work will always meet perfection or exceed industry standards, as such expectations may not be feasible given the specific challenges presented by each project.

original: B. Subcontractor shall comply with all applicable laws (including, without limitation the Federal Occupational Safety and Health Act, Hazardous Communication Requirements, and all applicable environmental protection laws, rules, regulations and ordinances), ordinances, rules, regulations and lawful orders of any public authority having jurisdiction for the safety of persons or property or to protect them from damage, injury or loss. Subcontractor shall comply with all occupational safety and health requirements, including such related publications (not included; but incorporated herein by reference):
ollama_generated: A. Contractor acknowledges that it is responsible for ensuring the Subcontractor's compliance with all applicable laws (including, but not limited to, the Federal Occupational Safety and Health Act, Hazardous Communication Requirements, and all relevant environmental protection laws, rules, regulations, and ordinances). The Contractor shall oversee that the Subcontractor adheres to all occupational safety and health requirements, including any related publications (not included; however, they are hereby incorporated by reference). Any failure to comply with these obligations shall be at the risk of the Contractor. This clause does not relieve the Subcontractor from its own legal responsibilities or liabilities under these laws.

original: STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT “EDGE-FTE”   Page 10 25.CHOICE OF LAW/FORUM The construction, interpretation, and performance of this Agreement and all transactions under it shall be governed by the laws of the State of Texas, irrespective of its conflict of law principles. Subcontractor and EDGE shall not be obligated to resolve by arbitration any claim or dispute related to the Agreement. It is mandatory that any controversy or claim arising out of or relating to the Agreement or the breach thereof shall be subject to the jurisdiction of the State of Texas and the venue shall be exclusively in Collin County, Texas for resolution.
ollama_generated:
25. JURISDICTION AND GOVERNING LAW

This EDGE-FTE STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT, its construction, interpretation, and execution of all transactions hereunder shall be exclusively subject to the laws of the State of Texas, disregarding any conflict of law rules that may apply. Contrary to the provisions in this Agreement, neither Subcontractor nor EDGE shall be compelled to engage in arbitration for any dispute or claim stemming from this Agreement. It is expressly agreed that any dispute or claim arising from this Agreement, its execution, or breach thereof will fall under the exclusive jurisdiction of Collin County, Texas, and all such disputes must be resolved within the State of Texas.

original: 26.TEXAS ALTERNATIVE DISPUTE RESOLUTION All claims, disputes and other matters in question arising out of or relating to this subcontract with a breach thereof, except for claims which have been waived by the making or acceptance of final payment, shall be decided by mediation or non-binding arbitration pursuant to the Texas Arbitration Dispute Resolution Act, (Texas Practice and Remedies Code, Chapter 154), and in accordance with the construction industry rules then in effect unless the parties mutually agree otherwise. Each party shall pay its own legal and other costs relating to the mediation or the non- binding arbitration regardless of the outcome of the mediation or the non-binding arbitration.
ollama_generated: 26. DISPUTE RESOLUTION - Texas Alternative Dispute Resolution: All disagreements, controversies, and issues stemming from this Subcontract or a breach thereof shall initially be resolved through a binding arbitration process in accordance with the Texas Arbitration Dispute Resolution Act (Texas Practice and Remedies Code, Chapter 154). This process will adhere to the construction industry rules currently applicable, unless the parties reach a mutual agreement to alter this method. The losing party in the arbitration will bear all legal and other costs associated with the process. However, if the parties fail to reach an agreement through arbitration, they may choose to engage in mediation at their own expense and without prejudice to either party's right to subsequently initiate a lawsuit.

In the event that either Party fails to meet its contractual obligations without undue delay, the other Party shall have the discretion to terminate this agreement with immediate effect and without liability. However, before termination, the aggrieved Party must provide written notice to the defaulting Party and afford it a reasonable opportunity (not exceeding 30 days) to remedy the breach. If the breach is not remedied within such timeframe, the receiving Party shall have no obligation to accept any further deliverables or performances from the defaulting Party under this agreement.
